content: 1 Originally was the Word, And the Word was with God; And the Word was God.
content_old: 1 Originally was the Word, And the Word was with God; And the Word was God.

content: 2 The same was originally with God.
content_old: 2 The same was originally with God.

content: 3 All things through him came into existence And without him came into existence not even one thing: That which hath come into existence
content_old: 3 All things through him came into existence And without him came into existence not even one thing: That which hath come into existence

content: 4 in him was life, And the life was the light of men.—
content_old: 4 in him was life, And the life was the light of men.—

content: 5 And the light in the darkness shineth; And the darkness thereof laid not hold.
content_old: 5 And the light in the darkness shineth; And the darkness thereof laid not hold.

content: 6 There arose a man､ sent from God, whose name was John:
content_old: 6 There arose a man､ sent from God, whose name was John:

content: 7 The same came for a witness､ That he might bear witness concerning the light, That all might believe through him.
content_old: 7 The same came for a witness､ That he might bear witness concerning the light, That all might believe through him.

content: 8 He was not the light,— But､ that he might bear witness concerning the light,
content_old: 8 He was not the light,— But､ that he might bear witness concerning the light,

content: 9 It was— The real light that enlighteneth every man— Coming into the world.
content_old: 9 It was— The real light that enlighteneth every man— Coming into the world.

content: 10 In the world he was､ And the world through him came into existence, And the world knew him not.
content_old: 10 In the world he was､ And the world through him came into existence, And the world knew him not.

content: 11 Into his own possessions he came, And his own people received him not home.
content_old: 11 Into his own possessions he came, And his own people received him not home.

content: 12 But as many as did receive him he gave unto them authority､ children of God to become,—unto them who were believing on his name:
content_old: 12 But as many as did receive him he gave unto them authority､ children of God to become,—unto them who were believing on his name:

content: 13 Who—not of bloods､ nor of the will of the flesh､ nor of the will of man, but— Of God were born.
content_old: 13 Who—not of bloods､ nor of the will of the flesh､ nor of the will of man, but— Of God were born.

content: 14 And the Word became flesh､ And pitched his tent among us, And we gazed upon his glory,— A glory as an Only-begotten from his Father. Full of favour and truth.
content_old: 14 And the Word became flesh､ And pitched his tent among us, And we gazed upon his glory,— A glory as an Only-begotten from his Father. Full of favour and truth.

content: 15 (John beareth witness concerning him､ and hath cried aloud, saying—the same was he that said— He who after me was coming Before me hath advanced; Because my Chief was he.)

content: 16 Because out of his fulness we all received, Even favour over against favour.

content: 17 Because the law through Moses was given, Favour and truth through Jesus Christ came into existence.

content: 18 No one hath seen God at any time: An Only Begotten God, The One existing within the bosom of the Father He､ hath interpreted him.

content: 19 And this is the witness of John, when the Jews sent forth unto him､ out of Jerusalem､ priests and Levites,—that they might question him— Who art thou?

content: 23 He said— I am a Voice､ of one crying aloud;— In the desert make ye straight､ the way of the Lord: according as said Isaiah the prophet.

content: 32 And John bare witness, saying— I have gazed upon the Spirit､ descending like a dove､ out of heaven,—and it abode upon him.

content: 33 And I knew him not,— But he that sent me to immerse in water he unto me said— Upon whomsoever thou shalt see the Spirit descending and abiding upon him the same is he that immerseth in Holy Spirit.

content: 1 There was however､ a man from among the Pharisees, Nicodemus his name,—ruler of the Jews.

content: 2 The same came unto him､ by night, and said unto him— Rabbi! we know that from God thou hast come､ a teacher; For no one can be doing these signs which thou art doing､ except God be with him.

content: 8 The spirit where it pleaseth doth breathe, And the sound thereof thou hearest; But knowest not､ whence it cometh and whither it goeth: Thus is every one who hath been born of the spirit.

content: 16 For God so loved the world､ That his Only Begotten Son he gave,— That whosoever believeth on him Might not perish､ But have life age-abiding.

content: 18 He that believeth on him is not to be judged: He that believeth not already hath been judged,— Because he hath not believed on the name of the Only Begotten Son of God.

content: 20 For whosoever doth practise corrupt things Hateth the light､ And cometh not unto the light, Lest his works should be reproved;

content_old: 10 Jesus answered､ and said unto her— If thou hadst known the free gift of God, and who it is that is saying unto thee､ Give me to drink thou wouldst have asked him, and he would have given thee living water.

content_old: 11 She saith unto him— Sir! not even a bucket hast thou,—and the well is deep:—Whence then､ hast thou the living water?

content: 12 Art thou greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well,—and himself out of it drank, and his sons､ and his flocks?

content: 2 Now there is in Jerusalem､ at the Sheep-gate､ a pool, which is called in Hebrew Bethzatha,—having five porches.

content: 19 Jesus､ therefore､ answered, and went on to say unto them— Verily､ verily I say unto you: The Son cannot be doing､ of himself､ a single thing,— Save anything he may see the Father doing; For whatsoever he may be doing These things the Son also､ in like manner doeth.

content: 20 For the Father dearly loveth the Son､ And all things pointeth out to him､ which himself is doing; And greater works than these will he point out to him, That ye may marvel.

content: 23 That all may honour the Son, Just as they honour the Father: He that doth not honour the Son Doth not､ in fact､ honour the Father who sent him.

content: 24 Verily､ verily I say unto you: He that heareth my word､ and believeth in him that sent me Hath life age-abiding, And into judgment cometh not､ But hath passed over､ out of death into life.

content_old: 32 Jesus said unto them— Verily､ verily I say unto you: Not Moses gave you the bread out of heaven; But my Father giveth you the real bread out of heaven.

content: 39 And this is the will of him that sent me､ That of all that which he hath given me I should lose nothing, But should raise it up at the last day.

content: 42 and were saying— Is not this Jesus､ the son of Joseph,— Of whom we know the father and the mother! How is it then､ that he now saith: Out of heaven have I come down?

content: 45 It is written in the prophets,— And they shall be､ all､ the instructed of God: Every one who hath heard of the Father､ and learned Cometh unto me.

content: 58 This is the bread､ which out of heaven came down:— Not just as your fathers did eat—and died! He that feedeth upon this bread Shall live unto times age-abiding.

content: 1 And after these things Jesus was walking in Galilee; for he was not wishing in Judæa to be walking, because the Jews were seeking to slay him.

content_old: 6 Jesus､ therefore､ saith unto them— My season not yet is here; But your season at any time is ready:

content: 8 Ye go up unto the feast: I not yet am coming up unto this feast, Because my season not yet hath fully come.

He was a murderer from the beginning, And in the truth he stood not; Because truth is not in him: Whensoever he speaketh falsehood Of his own he speaketh; Because false he is､ and the father of it.

content: 1 Now a certain man was sick, Lazarus of Bethany､ of the village of Mary and Martha her sister.
content_old: 1 Now a certain man was sick, Lazarus of Bethany､ of the village of Mary and Martha her sister.

content: 2 And Mary was she who anointed the Lord with perfume､ and wiped his feet with her hair,—whose brother Lazarus was sick.
content_old: 2 And Mary was she who anointed the Lord with perfume､ and wiped his feet with her hair,—whose brother Lazarus was sick.

content: 3 The sisters､ therefore､ sent out unto him､ saying— Lord, see! he whom thou tenderly lovest is sick.
content_old: 3 The sisters､ therefore､ sent out unto him､ saying— Lord, see! he whom thou tenderly lovest is sick.

content: 4 But Jesus hearing､ said— This sickness is not unto death, But for the glory of God,— That the Son of God may be glorified thereby.
content_old: 4 But Jesus hearing､ said— This sickness is not unto death, But for the glory of God,— That the Son of God may be glorified thereby.

content: 5 Now Jesus loved Martha､ and her sister､ and Lazarus.
content_old: 5 Now Jesus loved Martha､ and her sister､ and Lazarus.

content: 6 When､ therefore､ he heard that he was sick then indeed､ he abode in the place where he was､ two days.
content_old: 6 When､ therefore､ he heard that he was sick then indeed､ he abode in the place where he was､ two days.

content: 7 Then､ after this he saith unto the disciples— Let us be leading on into Judæa again.
content_old: 7 Then､ after this he saith unto the disciples— Let us be leading on into Judæa again.

content: 8 The disciples say unto him— Rabbi! just now were the Jews seeking to stone thee,— And again goest thou thither?
content_old: 8 The disciples say unto him— Rabbi! just now were the Jews seeking to stone thee,— And again goest thou thither?

content: 9 Jesus answered— Are there not twelve hours in the day? If one walk in the day he doth not stumble, Because the light of this world he seeth;
content_old: 9 Jesus answered— Are there not twelve hours in the day? If one walk in the day he doth not stumble, Because the light of this world he seeth;

content: 10 But if one walk in the night he stumbleth, Because the light is not in him.
content_old: 10 But if one walk in the night he stumbleth, Because the light is not in him.

content: 11 These things he said, and after this he saith unto them— Lazarus､ our dear friend hath fallen asleep; But I am going､ that I may awake him.
content_old: 11 These things he said, and after this he saith unto them— Lazarus､ our dear friend hath fallen asleep; But I am going､ that I may awake him.

content: 12 The disciples､ therefore､ said unto him— Lord! if he have fallen asleep he will recover.
content_old: 12 The disciples､ therefore､ said unto him— Lord! if he have fallen asleep he will recover.

content: 13 But Jesus had spoken concerning his death; whereas they supposed that concerning the taking of rest in sleep he had been speaking.
content_old: 13 But Jesus had spoken concerning his death; whereas they supposed that concerning the taking of rest in sleep he had been speaking.

content: 14 Jesus､ therefore then said unto them plainly— Lazarus died;
content_old: 14 Jesus､ therefore then said unto them plainly— Lazarus died;

content: 15 and I rejoice､ for your sake,—that ye may believe,—that I was not there; But let us be going unto him.
content_old: 15 and I rejoice､ for your sake,—that ye may believe,—that I was not there; But let us be going unto him.

content: 16 Thomas､ therefore､ the one called Didymus､ said unto his fellow-disciples— Let us also be going, that we may die with him.
content_old: 16 Thomas､ therefore､ the one called Didymus､ said unto his fellow-disciples— Let us also be going, that we may die with him.

content: 17 Jesus､ therefore､ coming, found that four days already had he been in the tomb.
content_old: 17 Jesus､ therefore､ coming, found that four days already had he been in the tomb.

content: 18 Now Bethany was near Jerusalem､ about fifteen furlongs off;
content_old: 18 Now Bethany was near Jerusalem､ about fifteen furlongs off;

content: 19 and many from among the Jews had come unto Martha and Mary, that they might console them concerning their brother.
content_old: 19 and many from among the Jews had come unto Martha and Mary, that they might console them concerning their brother.

content: 20 Martha therefore､ when she heard that Jesus was coming went to meet him; but Mary in the house remained sitting.
content_old: 20 Martha therefore､ when she heard that Jesus was coming went to meet him; but Mary in the house remained sitting.

content: 21 Martha､ therefore､ said unto Jesus— Lord! if thou hadst been here my brother had not died;
content_old: 21 Martha､ therefore､ said unto Jesus— Lord! if thou hadst been here my brother had not died;

content: 22 And now I know､ that whatsoever thou shalt ask of God God will give unto thee.
content_old: 22 And now I know､ that whatsoever thou shalt ask of God God will give unto thee.

content: 23 Jesus saith unto her— Thy brother shall rise.
content_old: 23 Jesus saith unto her— Thy brother shall rise.

content: 24 Martha saith unto him— I know that he shall rise､ in the resurrection､ in the last day.
content_old: 24 Martha saith unto him— I know that he shall rise､ in the resurrection､ in the last day.

content: 25 Jesus said unto her— I am the resurrection and the life: He that believeth on me Even though he die shall live again!
content_old: 25 Jesus said unto her— I am the resurrection and the life: He that believeth on me Even though he die shall live again!

content: 26 And no one who liveth again and believeth on me Shall in anywise die unto times age-abiding. Believest thou this?
content_old: 26 And no one who liveth again and believeth on me Shall in anywise die unto times age-abiding. Believest thou this?

content: 27 She saith unto him— Yea､ Lord! I have believed､ That thou art the Christ､ the Son of God,— He who into the world should come.
content_old: 27 She saith unto him— Yea､ Lord! I have believed､ That thou art the Christ､ the Son of God,— He who into the world should come.

content: 28 And this saying､ she went away､ and called Mary her sister, secretly saying— The teacher is present, and calleth thee.
content_old: 28 And this saying､ she went away､ and called Mary her sister, secretly saying— The teacher is present, and calleth thee.

content: 29 And she when she heard was roused up quickly, and was coming unto him.
content_old: 29 And she when she heard was roused up quickly, and was coming unto him.

content: 30 Not yet however､ had Jesus come into the village, but was still in the place where Martha met him.
content_old: 30 Not yet however､ had Jesus come into the village, but was still in the place where Martha met him.

content: 31 The Jews､ therefore､ who were with her in the house and consoling her seeing Mary､ that quickly she arose and went out followed her, supposing that she was withdrawing unto the tomb､ that she might weep there.
content_old: 31 The Jews､ therefore､ who were with her in the house and consoling her seeing Mary､ that quickly she arose and went out followed her, supposing that she was withdrawing unto the tomb､ that she might weep there.

content: 32 Mary therefore､ when she came where Jesus was seeing him fell at his feet､ saying unto him— Lord! if thou hadst been here my brother had not died.
content_old: 32 Mary therefore､ when she came where Jesus was seeing him fell at his feet､ saying unto him— Lord! if thou hadst been here my brother had not died.

content: 33 Jesus therefore､ when he saw her weeping､ and the Jews who came with her weeping was indignant in the spirit､ and troubled himself,
content_old: 33 Jesus therefore､ when he saw her weeping､ and the Jews who came with her weeping was indignant in the spirit､ and troubled himself,

content: 34 and said— Where have ye laid him? They say unto him— Lord! come and see.
content_old: 34 and said— Where have ye laid him? They say unto him— Lord! come and see.

content: 35 Jesus wept.
content_old: 35 Jesus wept.

content: 36 The Jews､ therefore､ were saying— See! how tenderly he loved him!
content_old: 36 The Jews､ therefore､ were saying— See! how tenderly he loved him!

content: 37 But some from among them said— Could not this man､ who opened the eyes of the blind､ have caused that this one also should not have died?
content_old: 37 But some from among them said— Could not this man､ who opened the eyes of the blind､ have caused that this one also should not have died?

content: 38 Jesus､ therefore､ again being indignant within himself cometh unto the tomb. Now it was a cave, and a stone was lying thereon.
content_old: 38 Jesus､ therefore､ again being indignant within himself cometh unto the tomb. Now it was a cave, and a stone was lying thereon.

content: 39 Jesus saith— Take ye away the stone! Martha､ the sister of the deceased､ saith unto him— Lord! by this time he stinketh, for it is four days.
content_old: 39 Jesus saith— Take ye away the stone! Martha､ the sister of the deceased､ saith unto him— Lord! by this time he stinketh, for it is four days.

content: 40 Jesus saith unto her— Said I not unto thee That if thou wouldst believe thou shouldst see the glory of God?
content_old: 40 Jesus saith unto her— Said I not unto thee That if thou wouldst believe thou shouldst see the glory of God?

content: 41 So they took away the stone. And Jesus lifted up his eyes on high､ and said— Father! I thank thee､ thou didst hear me:
content_old: 41 So they took away the stone. And Jesus lifted up his eyes on high､ and said— Father! I thank thee､ thou didst hear me:

content: 42 I indeed､ knew that always unto me thou dost hearken; But for the sake of the multitude standing around I spake,— That they might believe that thou didst send me forth.
content_old: 42 I indeed､ knew that always unto me thou dost hearken; But for the sake of the multitude standing around I spake,— That they might believe that thou didst send me forth.

content: 43 And these things having said, with a loud voice he cried out— Lazarus! come forth!
content_old: 43 And these things having said, with a loud voice he cried out— Lazarus! come forth!

content: 44 He that was dead came forth, bound feet and hands with bandages, and his face with a napkin was bound about. Jesus saith unto them— Loose him､ and let him go.
content_old: 44 He that was dead came forth, bound feet and hands with bandages, and his face with a napkin was bound about. Jesus saith unto them— Loose him､ and let him go.

content: 45 Many therefore from among the Jews､ who had come unto Mary､ and gazed on what he did believed on him;
content_old: 45 Many therefore from among the Jews､ who had come unto Mary､ and gazed on what he did believed on him;

content: 46 but certain from among them went away unto the Pharisees､ and told them what Jesus had done.
content_old: 46 but certain from among them went away unto the Pharisees､ and told them what Jesus had done.

content: 47 The High-priests and Pharisees､ therefore､ brought together a high-council, and were saying— What are we to do､ in that this man doeth many signs?
content_old: 47 The High-priests and Pharisees､ therefore､ brought together a high-council, and were saying— What are we to do､ in that this man doeth many signs?

content: 48 If we let him alone thus all will believe on him, and the Romans will come､ and take away both our place and nation.
content_old: 48 If we let him alone thus all will believe on him, and the Romans will come､ and take away both our place and nation.

content: 49 But a certain one from among them, Caiaphas being High-priest for that year said unto them— Ye know nothing at all;
content_old: 49 But a certain one from among them, Caiaphas being High-priest for that year said unto them— Ye know nothing at all;

content: 50 nor do ye take into account､ that it is profitable for you that one man should die for the people, and not the whole nation perish.
content_old: 50 nor do ye take into account､ that it is profitable for you that one man should die for the people, and not the whole nation perish.

content: 51 This however､ from himself he spake not, but being High-priest for that year he prophesied､ that Jesus was about to die for the nation;
content_old: 51 This however､ from himself he spake not, but being High-priest for that year he prophesied､ that Jesus was about to die for the nation;

content: 52 and not for the nation only but that the scattered children of God also he might gather together into one.
content_old: 52 and not for the nation only but that the scattered children of God also he might gather together into one.

content: 53 From that day therefore､ they took counsel､ that they might put him to death.
content_old: 53 From that day therefore､ they took counsel､ that they might put him to death.

content: 54 Jesus therefore､ no longer openly was walking among the Jews, but departed thence､ into the country near the desert, unto a city called Ephraim; and there abode､ with his disciples.
content_old: 54 Jesus therefore､ no longer openly was walking among the Jews, but departed thence､ into the country near the desert, unto a city called Ephraim; and there abode､ with his disciples.

content: 55 Now the passover of the Jews was at hand, and many went up unto Jerusalem､ out of the country､ before the passover, that they might purify themselves.
content_old: 55 Now the passover of the Jews was at hand, and many went up unto Jerusalem､ out of the country､ before the passover, that they might purify themselves.

content: 56 They were therefore seeking Jesus､ and were saying one to another､ in the temple standing— How seemeth it unto you? that he will in nowise come unto the feast?
content_old: 56 They were therefore seeking Jesus､ and were saying one to another､ in the temple standing— How seemeth it unto you? that he will in nowise come unto the feast?

content: 1 Jesus therefore､ six days before the passover came unto Bethany, where Lazarus was､ whom Jesus had raised from among the dead.
content_old: 1 Jesus therefore､ six days before the passover came unto Bethany, where Lazarus was､ whom Jesus had raised from among the dead.

content: 2 So they made for him a supper､ there; and Martha was ministering, but Lazarus was one of them who were reclining with him.
content_old: 2 So they made for him a supper､ there; and Martha was ministering, but Lazarus was one of them who were reclining with him.

content: 3 Mary therefore､ taking a pound of pure nard perfume､ very precious anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped､ with her hair､ his feet; and the house was filled with the fragrance of the perfume.
content_old: 3 Mary therefore､ taking a pound of pure nard perfume､ very precious anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped､ with her hair､ his feet; and the house was filled with the fragrance of the perfume.

content: 4 But Judas Iscariot､ one of his disciples, he that was about to deliver him up, saith—
content_old: 4 But Judas Iscariot､ one of his disciples, he that was about to deliver him up, saith—

content: 5 Why was this perfume not sold for three hundred denaries, and given unto the destitute?
content_old: 5 Why was this perfume not sold for three hundred denaries, and given unto the destitute?

content: 6 Howbeit he said this, not that for the destitute he cared but because a thief he was, and holding the bag used to carry away what was cast therein.
content_old: 6 Howbeit he said this, not that for the destitute he cared but because a thief he was, and holding the bag used to carry away what was cast therein.

content: 7 Jesus､ therefore､ said— Let her alone, that for the day of my burial she may observe it;
content_old: 7 Jesus､ therefore､ said— Let her alone, that for the day of my burial she may observe it;

content: 8 For the destitute always have ye with you, whereas me not always have ye.
content_old: 8 For the destitute always have ye with you, whereas me not always have ye.

content: 9 The great multitude of the Jews､ therefore､ got to know that he was there, and came not on account of Jesus only but that Lazarus also they might see, whom he had raised from among the dead.
content_old: 9 The great multitude of the Jews､ therefore､ got to know that he was there, and came not on account of Jesus only but that Lazarus also they might see, whom he had raised from among the dead.

content: 10 But the High-priests took counsel that Lazarus also they might put to death;
content_old: 10 But the High-priests took counsel that Lazarus also they might put to death;

content: 11 because many of the Jews by reason of him were withdrawing､ and believing on Jesus.
content_old: 11 because many of the Jews by reason of him were withdrawing､ and believing on Jesus.

content: 12 On the morrow the great multitude that had come unto the feast hearing that Jesus was coming into Jerusalem
content_old: 12 On the morrow the great multitude that had come unto the feast hearing that Jesus was coming into Jerusalem

content: 13 took the branches of the palm trees､ and went out to meet him, and began crying aloud— Hosanna! Blessed is he that is coming in the name of the Lord,— Even the King of Israel!
content_old: 13 took the branches of the palm trees､ and went out to meet him, and began crying aloud— Hosanna! Blessed is he that is coming in the name of the Lord,— Even the King of Israel!

content: 14 And Jesus､ finding a young ass､ took his seat thereon, just as it is written—
content_old: 14 And Jesus､ finding a young ass､ took his seat thereon, just as it is written—

content: 15 Do not fear, O daughter of Zion! Lo! thy king cometh, Sitting upon the colt of an ass!
content_old: 15 Do not fear, O daughter of Zion! Lo! thy king cometh, Sitting upon the colt of an ass!

content: 16 These things his disciples noticed not､ at the first; but when Jesus was glorifled then remembered they that these things had for him been written,—and that these things they had done unto him.
content_old: 16 These things his disciples noticed not､ at the first; but when Jesus was glorifled then remembered they that these things had for him been written,—and that these things they had done unto him.

content: 17 The multitude､ therefore､ that was with him when he called Lazarus out of the tomb､ and raised him from among the dead, was bearing witness.
content_old: 17 The multitude､ therefore､ that was with him when he called Lazarus out of the tomb､ and raised him from among the dead, was bearing witness.

content: 18 On this account the multitude met him also, because they heard that he had done this sign.
content_old: 18 On this account the multitude met him also, because they heard that he had done this sign.

content: 19 The Pharisees therefore､ said among themselves— Ye observe that ye are profiting nothing: See! the world after him hath gone away.
content_old: 19 The Pharisees therefore､ said among themselves— Ye observe that ye are profiting nothing: See! the world after him hath gone away.

content: 20 Now there were certain Greeks､ from among them who were coming up that they might worship in the feast.
content_old: 20 Now there were certain Greeks､ from among them who were coming up that they might worship in the feast.

content: 21 These therefore､ came unto Philip, him who was from Bethsaida of Galilee,—and were requesting him､ saying— Sir! we desire to see Jesus.
content_old: 21 These therefore､ came unto Philip, him who was from Bethsaida of Galilee,—and were requesting him､ saying— Sir! we desire to see Jesus.

content: 22 Philip cometh､ and telleth Andrew: Andrew and Philip come､ and tell Jesus.
content_old: 22 Philip cometh､ and telleth Andrew: Andrew and Philip come､ and tell Jesus.

content: 23 But Jesus answereth them､ saying— The hour hath come, that the Son of Man should be glorified!
content_old: 23 But Jesus answereth them､ saying— The hour hath come, that the Son of Man should be glorified!

content: 24 Verily､ verily I say unto you: Except the kernel of wheat shall fall into the ground､ and die It alone abideth; But if it die Much fruit it beareth.
content_old: 24 Verily､ verily I say unto you: Except the kernel of wheat shall fall into the ground､ and die It alone abideth; But if it die Much fruit it beareth.

content: 25 He that loveth his life Loseth it; But he that hateth his life in this world Unto life age-abiding shall guard it.
content_old: 25 He that loveth his life Loseth it; But he that hateth his life in this world Unto life age-abiding shall guard it.

content: 26 If with me anyone be ministering With me let him be following; And where I am There my minister also shall be. If anyone with me be ministering The Father will honour him.
content_old: 26 If with me anyone be ministering With me let him be following; And where I am There my minister also shall be. If anyone with me be ministering The Father will honour him.

content: 27 Now is my soul troubled,— And what can I say? Father! save me from this hour? But on this account came I unto this hour. Father, glorify thy name!
content_old: 27 Now is my soul troubled,— And what can I say? Father! save me from this hour? But on this account came I unto this hour. Father, glorify thy name!

content: 28 There came､ therefore､ a voice out of heaven— I both have glorified it, and will glorify it again.
content_old: 28 There came､ therefore､ a voice out of heaven— I both have glorified it, and will glorify it again.

content: 29 So the multitude that was standing by､ and heard it were saying— It hath thundered. Others were saying— A messenger unto him hath spoken.
content_old: 29 So the multitude that was standing by､ and heard it were saying— It hath thundered. Others were saying— A messenger unto him hath spoken.

content: 30 Jesus answered､ and said— Not for my sake hath this voice come, but for your sake.
content_old: 30 Jesus answered､ and said— Not for my sake hath this voice come, but for your sake.

content: 31 Now is there a judging of this world,— Now the ruler of this world shall be cast out;
content_old: 31 Now is there a judging of this world,— Now the ruler of this world shall be cast out;

content: 32 And I if I be lifted up out of the earth will draw all unto myself.
content_old: 32 And I if I be lifted up out of the earth will draw all unto myself.

content: 33 But this he was saying､ signifying by what manner of death he was about to die.
content_old: 33 But this he was saying､ signifying by what manner of death he was about to die.

content: 34 The multitude､ therefore､ answered him— We have heard､ out of the law, that the Christ abideth evermore; How then dost thou say,— It behoveth the Son of Man to be lifted up? Who is this Son of Man?
content_old: 34 The multitude､ therefore､ answered him— We have heard､ out of the law, that the Christ abideth evermore; How then dost thou say,— It behoveth the Son of Man to be lifted up? Who is this Son of Man?

content: 35 Jesus､ therefore､ said unto them— Yet a little while the light is among you: Walk､ while ye have the light, Lest darkness on you should lay hold; And he that walketh in darkness knoweth not whither he drifteth.
content_old: 35 Jesus､ therefore､ said unto them— Yet a little while the light is among you: Walk､ while ye have the light, Lest darkness on you should lay hold; And he that walketh in darkness knoweth not whither he drifteth.

content: 36 While the light ye have Believe on the light, That sons of light ye may become. These things spake Jesus,—and､ departing､ was hid from them.
content_old: 36 While the light ye have Believe on the light, That sons of light ye may become. These things spake Jesus,—and､ departing､ was hid from them.

content: 37 And although such signs as these he had done before them they were not believing on him:—
content_old: 37 And although such signs as these he had done before them they were not believing on him:—

content: 38 that the word of Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled､ which said— Lord! who believed what we have heard? And the arm of the Lord to whom was it revealed?
content_old: 38 that the word of Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled､ which said— Lord! who believed what we have heard? And the arm of the Lord to whom was it revealed?

content: 39 On this account they could not believe, because again said Isaiah—
content_old: 39 On this account they could not believe, because again said Isaiah—

content: 40 He hath blinded their eyes､ and hardened their heart; Lest they should see with their eyes､ and should understand with their heart, and should turn,— And I should heal them.
content_old: 40 He hath blinded their eyes､ and hardened their heart; Lest they should see with their eyes､ and should understand with their heart, and should turn,— And I should heal them.

content: 41 These things said Isaiah, because he saw his glory､ and spake concerning him.
content_old: 41 These things said Isaiah, because he saw his glory､ and spake concerning him.

content: 42 Nevertheless､ however even from among the rulers many believed on him; but because of the Pharisees they were not confessing him, lest excommunicants from the synagogue they should be made;
content_old: 42 Nevertheless､ however even from among the rulers many believed on him; but because of the Pharisees they were not confessing him, lest excommunicants from the synagogue they should be made;

content: 43 for they loved the glory of men､ more than the glory of God.
content_old: 43 for they loved the glory of men､ more than the glory of God.

content: 44 And Jesus cried aloud､ and said— He that believeth on me Believeth not on me､ but on him that sent me;
content_old: 44 And Jesus cried aloud､ and said— He that believeth on me Believeth not on me､ but on him that sent me;

content: 45 And he that vieweth me Vieweth him that sent me.
content_old: 45 And he that vieweth me Vieweth him that sent me.

content: 46 I a light into the world have come, That no one who believeth on me in darkness should abide.
content_old: 46 I a light into the world have come, That no one who believeth on me in darkness should abide.

content: 47 And if anyone shall hearken unto my sayings､ and not guard them I am not judging him; For I came not that I might judge the world, But that I might save the world.
content_old: 47 And if anyone shall hearken unto my sayings､ and not guard them I am not judging him; For I came not that I might judge the world, But that I might save the world.

content: 48 He that setteth me aside､ and receiveth not my sayings Hath that which is to judge him: The word that I spake that will judge him､ in the last day.
content_old: 48 He that setteth me aside､ and receiveth not my sayings Hath that which is to judge him: The word that I spake that will judge him､ in the last day.

content: 49 Because I out of myself spake not, But the Father who sent me hath himself given me commandment, What I should say､ and what I should speak.
content_old: 49 Because I out of myself spake not, But the Father who sent me hath himself given me commandment, What I should say､ and what I should speak.

content: 1 Now before the feast of the passover Jesus knowing that his hour had come､ that he should remove out of this world unto the Father having loved his own that were in the world unto the end loved them.
content_old: 1 Now before the feast of the passover Jesus knowing that his hour had come､ that he should remove out of this world unto the Father having loved his own that were in the world unto the end loved them.

content: 2 And supper being in progress, the adversary having already thrust into the heart of Judas son of Simon Iscariot､ that he should deliver him up,—
content_old: 2 And supper being in progress, the adversary having already thrust into the heart of Judas son of Simon Iscariot､ that he should deliver him up,—

content: 3 Jesus knowing that all things the Father had given unto him､ into his hands, and that from God he had come､ and unto God he was going
content_old: 3 Jesus knowing that all things the Father had given unto him､ into his hands, and that from God he had come､ and unto God he was going

content: 4 rouseth himself out of the supper, and layeth aside his garments, and､ taking a linen cloth､ girded himself.
content_old: 4 rouseth himself out of the supper, and layeth aside his garments, and､ taking a linen cloth､ girded himself.

content: 5 Next he poureth water into the wash-basin, and began to be washing the feet of the disciples､ and to be wiping them with the linen cloth wherewith he was girded.
content_old: 5 Next he poureth water into the wash-basin, and began to be washing the feet of the disciples､ and to be wiping them with the linen cloth wherewith he was girded.

content: 6 So he cometh unto Simon Peter. He saith unto him— Lord, dost thou wash my feet?
content_old: 6 So he cometh unto Simon Peter. He saith unto him— Lord, dost thou wash my feet?

content: 7 Jesus answered､ and said unto him— What I am doing thou knowest not as yet; Howbeit､ thou shalt get to know hereafter.
content_old: 7 Jesus answered､ and said unto him— What I am doing thou knowest not as yet; Howbeit､ thou shalt get to know hereafter.

content: 8 Peter saith unto him— In nowise shalt thou ever wash my feet. Jesus answered him— If I wash thee not thou hast no part with me.
content_old: 8 Peter saith unto him— In nowise shalt thou ever wash my feet. Jesus answered him— If I wash thee not thou hast no part with me.

content: 9 Simon Peter saith unto him— Lord! not my feet only, but my hands also､ and my head.
content_old: 9 Simon Peter saith unto him— Lord! not my feet only, but my hands also､ and my head.

content: 10 Jesus saith unto him— He that hath bathed himself hath no need save as to the feet to get washed; but is pure as a whole. And ye are pure, but not ye all.
content_old: 10 Jesus saith unto him— He that hath bathed himself hath no need save as to the feet to get washed; but is pure as a whole. And ye are pure, but not ye all.

content: 11 For he knew the man that was delivering him up; therefore said he— Not ye all､ are pure.
content_old: 11 For he knew the man that was delivering him up; therefore said he— Not ye all､ are pure.

content: 12 When､ therefore､ he had washed their feet, and taken his garments､ and reclined again said he unto them— Are ye taking note､ what I have done unto you?
content_old: 12 When､ therefore､ he had washed their feet, and taken his garments､ and reclined again said he unto them— Are ye taking note､ what I have done unto you?

content: 13 Ye call me The Teacher and The Lord,— and well say, for I am.
content_old: 13 Ye call me The Teacher and The Lord,— and well say, for I am.

content: 14 If then I have washed your feet,—I The Lord and The Teacher Ye also ought to wash one another’s feet;
content_old: 14 If then I have washed your feet,—I The Lord and The Teacher Ye also ought to wash one another’s feet;

content: 15 For an example have I given you,— That just as I did unto you Ye also should be doing.
content_old: 15 For an example have I given you,— That just as I did unto you Ye also should be doing.

content: 16 Verily､ verily I say unto you— A servant is not greater than his lord, Neither one sent forth greater than he that sent him.
content_old: 16 Verily､ verily I say unto you— A servant is not greater than his lord, Neither one sent forth greater than he that sent him.

content: 17 If these things ye know Happy are ye､ if ye be doing them.
content_old: 17 If these things ye know Happy are ye､ if ye be doing them.

content: 18 Not concerning you all am I speaking,— For I know of whom I made choice; But … that the Scripture might be fulfilled: He that feedeth on my bread Hath lifted up against me､ his heel.
content_old: 18 Not concerning you all am I speaking,— For I know of whom I made choice; But … that the Scripture might be fulfilled: He that feedeth on my bread Hath lifted up against me､ his heel.

content: 19 Henceforth､ I tell you before it cometh to pass,— That ye may believe､ whensoever it doth come to pass､ that I am he.
content_old: 19 Henceforth､ I tell you before it cometh to pass,— That ye may believe､ whensoever it doth come to pass､ that I am he.

content: 20 Verily､ verily I say unto you— He that receiveth whomsoever I shall send Receiveth me; And he that receiveth me Receiveth him that sent me.
content_old: 20 Verily､ verily I say unto you— He that receiveth whomsoever I shall send Receiveth me; And he that receiveth me Receiveth him that sent me.

content: 21 These things having said Jesus was troubled in spirit, and bare witness､ and said— Verily､ verily I say unto you— One from among you will deliver me up.
content_old: 21 These things having said Jesus was troubled in spirit, and bare witness､ and said— Verily､ verily I say unto you— One from among you will deliver me up.

content: 22 The disciples began to look one at another, being at a loss concerning whom he as speaking.
content_old: 22 The disciples began to look one at another, being at a loss concerning whom he as speaking.

content: 23 One of Jesus’ disciples was reclining in his bosom, one whom Jesus loved:
content_old: 23 One of Jesus’ disciples was reclining in his bosom, one whom Jesus loved:

content: 24 so Simon Peter beckoneth unto the same, and saith unto him— Say Who is it? concerning whom he speaketh.
content_old: 24 so Simon Peter beckoneth unto the same, and saith unto him— Say Who is it? concerning whom he speaketh.

content: 25 He falling back thus､ upon the breast of Jesus saith unto him— Lord! who is it?
content_old: 25 He falling back thus､ upon the breast of Jesus saith unto him— Lord! who is it?

content: 26 Jesus､ therefore､ answereth— That one it is､ for whom I shall dip the morsel､ and give unto him. So dipping the morsel he taketh and giveth it unto Judas､ son of Simon Iscariot.
content_old: 26 Jesus､ therefore､ answereth— That one it is､ for whom I shall dip the morsel､ and give unto him. So dipping the morsel he taketh and giveth it unto Judas､ son of Simon Iscariot.

content: 27 And after the morsel then entered Satan into that man. Jesus､ therefore､ saith unto him— What thou art doing do quickly!
content_old: 27 And after the morsel then entered Satan into that man. Jesus､ therefore､ saith unto him— What thou art doing do quickly!

content: 28 But as to this none of them who were reclining with him knew respecting what､ he said it to him.
content_old: 28 But as to this none of them who were reclining with him knew respecting what､ he said it to him.

content: 29 For some were thinking since Judas held the bag that Jesus was saying to him— Buy the things of which we have need for the feast; or that unto the destitute he should give something.
content_old: 29 For some were thinking since Judas held the bag that Jesus was saying to him— Buy the things of which we have need for the feast; or that unto the destitute he should give something.

content: 30 So he taking the morsel､ went out straightway;—and it was night.
content_old: 30 So he taking the morsel､ went out straightway;—and it was night.

content: 31 When､ therefore､ he had gone out Jesus saith— Just now was the Son of Man glorified, And God was glorified in him;
content_old: 31 When､ therefore､ he had gone out Jesus saith— Just now was the Son of Man glorified, And God was glorified in him;

content: 32 And God will glorify him in himself,— And straightway glorify him.
content_old: 32 And God will glorify him in himself,— And straightway glorify him.

content: 33 Dear children! Yet a little am I with you. Ye shall seek me, and just as I said unto the Jews､ Whither I go ye cannot come Unto you also I say it even now.
content_old: 33 Dear children! Yet a little am I with you. Ye shall seek me, and just as I said unto the Jews､ Whither I go ye cannot come Unto you also I say it even now.

content: 34 A new commandment give I unto you,— That ye be loving one another: Just as I loved you That ye also be loving one another:
content_old: 34 A new commandment give I unto you,— That ye be loving one another: Just as I loved you That ye also be loving one another:

content: 35 By this shall all men take knowledge､ that my disciples ye are,— If ye have love one to another.
content_old: 35 By this shall all men take knowledge､ that my disciples ye are,— If ye have love one to another.

content: 36 Simon Peter saith unto him— Lord! whither dost thou withdraw? Jesus answered— Whither I withdraw thou canst not now follow me, But thou shalt follow hereafter.
content_old: 36 Simon Peter saith unto him— Lord! whither dost thou withdraw? Jesus answered— Whither I withdraw thou canst not now follow me, But thou shalt follow hereafter.

content: 37 Peter saith unto him— Lord! why cannot I follow thee even now? My life in thy behalf will I lay down.
content_old: 37 Peter saith unto him— Lord! why cannot I follow thee even now? My life in thy behalf will I lay down.

content: 1 Let not your heart be troubled: Believe on God, And on me believe.
content_old: 1 Let not your heart be troubled: Believe on God, And on me believe.

content: 2 In the house of my Father are many dwellings; Or else I would have told you､ I go to prepare a place for you.
content_old: 2 In the house of my Father are many dwellings; Or else I would have told you､ I go to prepare a place for you.

content: 3 And if I go､ and prepare a place for you Again am I coming､ and will take you home unto myself, That where I am ye also may be.
content_old: 3 And if I go､ and prepare a place for you Again am I coming､ and will take you home unto myself, That where I am ye also may be.

content: 4 And whither I go ye know the way.
content_old: 4 And whither I go ye know the way.

content: 5 Thomas saith unto him— Lord! we know not whither thou goest: How know we the way?
content_old: 5 Thomas saith unto him— Lord! we know not whither thou goest: How know we the way?

content: 6 Jesus saith unto him— I am the way and the truth､ and the life: No one cometh unto the Father､ but through me.
content_old: 6 Jesus saith unto him— I am the way and the truth､ and the life: No one cometh unto the Father､ but through me.

content: 7 If ye had been getting to know me My Father also had ye known: From henceforth are ye getting to know him, and have seen him.
content_old: 7 If ye had been getting to know me My Father also had ye known: From henceforth are ye getting to know him, and have seen him.

content: 8 Philip saith unto him— Lord! show us the Father, and it sufficeth us.
content_old: 8 Philip saith unto him— Lord! show us the Father, and it sufficeth us.

content: 9 Jesus saith unto him— So long a time as this have I been with you,— And thou hast not come to know me､ Philip? He that hath seen me hath seen the Father. How art thou saying､ Show us the Father?
content_old: 9 Jesus saith unto him— So long a time as this have I been with you,— And thou hast not come to know me､ Philip? He that hath seen me hath seen the Father. How art thou saying､ Show us the Father?

content: 10 Believest thou not, that I am in the Father､ and the Father is in me? The things which I am saying unto you From myself I speak not; But the Father､ within me abiding､ doeth his works.
content_old: 10 Believest thou not, that I am in the Father､ and the Father is in me? The things which I am saying unto you From myself I speak not; But the Father､ within me abiding､ doeth his works.

content: 11 Believe me､ That I am in the Father, And the Father in me;— Or else on account of the works themselves believe ye.
content_old: 11 Believe me､ That I am in the Father, And the Father in me;— Or else on account of the works themselves believe ye.

content: 12 Verily､ verily I say unto you— He that believeth on me The works which I am doing he also shall do; And greater than these shall he do, Because I unto the Father am going,—
content_old: 12 Verily､ verily I say unto you— He that believeth on me The works which I am doing he also shall do; And greater than these shall he do, Because I unto the Father am going,—

content: 13 And because whatsoever ye shall ask in my name the same will I do, That the Father may be glorified in the Son:
content_old: 13 And because whatsoever ye shall ask in my name the same will I do, That the Father may be glorified in the Son:

content: 14 If anything ye shall ask me in my name the same will I do.
content_old: 14 If anything ye shall ask me in my name the same will I do.

content: 15 If ye be loving me my commandments ye will keep;
content_old: 15 If ye be loving me my commandments ye will keep;

content: 16 And I will request the Father, And Another Advocate will he give unto you, That he may be with you age-abidingly,—
content_old: 16 And I will request the Father, And Another Advocate will he give unto you, That he may be with you age-abidingly,—

content: 17 The Spirit of truth,— Which the world cannot receive, Because it beholdeth it not､ nor getteth to know it. But ye are getting to know it; Because with you it abideth, And in you it is.
content_old: 17 The Spirit of truth,— Which the world cannot receive, Because it beholdeth it not､ nor getteth to know it. But ye are getting to know it; Because with you it abideth, And in you it is.

content: 18 I will not leave you bereft,— I am coming unto you.
content_old: 18 I will not leave you bereft,— I am coming unto you.

content: 19 Yet a little and the world no longer beholdeth me; But ye behold me,— Because I live Ye also shall live.
content_old: 19 Yet a little and the world no longer beholdeth me; But ye behold me,— Because I live Ye also shall live.

content: 20 In that day shall ye get to know､ That I am in my Father, And ye in me, And I in you.
content_old: 20 In that day shall ye get to know､ That I am in my Father, And ye in me, And I in you.

content: 21 He that hath my commandments and keepeth them He it is that loveth me; And he that loveth me Shall be loved by my Father, And I will love him､ and will manifest myself unto him.
content_old: 21 He that hath my commandments and keepeth them He it is that loveth me; And he that loveth me Shall be loved by my Father, And I will love him､ and will manifest myself unto him.

content: 22 Judas､ not the Iscariot､ saith unto him— Lord! what hath happened､ That unto us thou art about to manifest thyself, and not unto the world?
content_old: 22 Judas､ not the Iscariot､ saith unto him— Lord! what hath happened､ That unto us thou art about to manifest thyself, and not unto the world?

content: 23 Jesus answered､ and said unto him— If any man be loving me My word he will keep, And my Father will love him,— And unto him will we come､ And an abode with him will we make.
content_old: 23 Jesus answered､ and said unto him— If any man be loving me My word he will keep, And my Father will love him,— And unto him will we come､ And an abode with him will we make.

content: 24 He that loveth me not Doth not keep my word;— And the word which ye hear is not mine, But the Father’s who sent me.
content_old: 24 He that loveth me not Doth not keep my word;— And the word which ye hear is not mine, But the Father’s who sent me.

content: 25 These things have I spoken unto you､ With you abiding;
content_old: 25 These things have I spoken unto you､ With you abiding;

content: 26 But the Advocate, The Holy Spirit､ which the Father will send in my name He will teach you all things､ And will put you in mind of all things which I told you.
content_old: 26 But the Advocate, The Holy Spirit､ which the Father will send in my name He will teach you all things､ And will put you in mind of all things which I told you.

content: 27 Peace I leave with you, My own peace give I unto you,— Not as the world giveth give I unto you:— Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.
content_old: 27 Peace I leave with you, My own peace give I unto you,— Not as the world giveth give I unto you:— Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.

content: 28 Ye heard that I said unto you— I go my way､ and I come unto you,— Had ye loved me ye would have rejoiced､ that I am going unto the Father, For the Father is greater than I.
content_old: 28 Ye heard that I said unto you— I go my way､ and I come unto you,— Had ye loved me ye would have rejoiced､ that I am going unto the Father, For the Father is greater than I.

content: 29 But now have I told you､ before it cometh to pass, That whensoever it shall come to pass ye may believe.
content_old: 29 But now have I told you､ before it cometh to pass, That whensoever it shall come to pass ye may believe.

content: 30 No longer many things will I speak with you; For the world’s ruler is coming, And in me hath nothing,—
content_old: 30 No longer many things will I speak with you; For the world’s ruler is coming, And in me hath nothing,—

content: 1 I am the real vine, And my Father is the husbandman:
content_old: 1 I am the real vine, And my Father is the husbandman:

content: 2 Every branch in me that beareth not fruit He taketh it away; And every one that beareth fruit He pruneth it, that more fruit it may bear.
content_old: 2 Every branch in me that beareth not fruit He taketh it away; And every one that beareth fruit He pruneth it, that more fruit it may bear.

content: 3 Already､ ye are pure because of the word which I have spoken unto you:
content_old: 3 Already､ ye are pure because of the word which I have spoken unto you:

content: 4 Abide in me, And I in you. Just as the branch cannot be bearing fruit of itself, Except it abide in the vine So neither ye except in me ye abide.
content_old: 4 Abide in me, And I in you. Just as the branch cannot be bearing fruit of itself, Except it abide in the vine So neither ye except in me ye abide.

content: 5 I am the vine: Ye are the branches. He that abideth in me and I in him The same beareth much fruit; Because apart from me ye can bring forth nothing.
content_old: 5 I am the vine: Ye are the branches. He that abideth in me and I in him The same beareth much fruit; Because apart from me ye can bring forth nothing.

content: 6 If one abide not in me He is cast out as the branch､ and withered, And they gather them,— And into fire they cast them､ And they are burned.
content_old: 6 If one abide not in me He is cast out as the branch､ and withered, And they gather them,— And into fire they cast them､ And they are burned.

content: 7 If ye abide in me､ and my sayings in you abide Whatsoever ye may be desiring ask! And it shall be brought to pass for you.
content_old: 7 If ye abide in me､ and my sayings in you abide Whatsoever ye may be desiring ask! And it shall be brought to pass for you.

content: 8 Herein was my Father glorified, That much fruit ye should bear､ And become my disciples.
content_old: 8 Herein was my Father glorified, That much fruit ye should bear､ And become my disciples.

content: 9 Just as the Father loved me I also loved you: Abide ye in my love.
content_old: 9 Just as the Father loved me I also loved you: Abide ye in my love.

content: 10 If my commandments ye keep Ye shall abide in my love,— Just as I the Father’s commandments have kept, And abide in his love.
content_old: 10 If my commandments ye keep Ye shall abide in my love,— Just as I the Father’s commandments have kept, And abide in his love.

content: 11 These things have I spoken unto you､ That my own joy in you may be, And your joy may be made full.
content_old: 11 These things have I spoken unto you､ That my own joy in you may be, And your joy may be made full.

content: 12 This is my own commandment､ That ye be loving one another, Just as I loved you.
content_old: 12 This is my own commandment､ That ye be loving one another, Just as I loved you.

content: 13 Greater love than this hath no one, That his life one should lay down in behalf of his friends.
content_old: 13 Greater love than this hath no one, That his life one should lay down in behalf of his friends.

content: 14 Ye are friends of mine, If ye be doing that which I am commanding you.
content_old: 14 Ye are friends of mine, If ye be doing that which I am commanding you.

content: 15 No longer do I call you servants, For the servant knoweth not what his lord is doing. But you I have called friends, Because all things which I heard from my Father made I known unto you.
content_old: 15 No longer do I call you servants, For the servant knoweth not what his lord is doing. But you I have called friends, Because all things which I heard from my Father made I known unto you.

content: 16 Not ye chose me, But I chose you､ and placed you, That ye should go your way and bear fruit,— And your fruit should abide: That whatsoever ye should ask the Father in my name he might give unto you.
content_old: 16 Not ye chose me, But I chose you､ and placed you, That ye should go your way and bear fruit,— And your fruit should abide: That whatsoever ye should ask the Father in my name he might give unto you.

content: 17 These things I command you､ That ye be loving one another.
content_old: 17 These things I command you､ That ye be loving one another.

content: 18 If the world is hating you Ye are getting to know that me､ before you it hath hated.
content_old: 18 If the world is hating you Ye are getting to know that me､ before you it hath hated.

content: 19 If of the world ye had been The world of its own had been fond; But because of the world ye are not, On the contrary I chose you out of the world Therefore the world doth hate you.
content_old: 19 If of the world ye had been The world of its own had been fond; But because of the world ye are not, On the contrary I chose you out of the world Therefore the world doth hate you.

content: 20 Remember the word which I spake unto you: A servant is not greater than his lord. If me they persecuted you too will they persecute,— If my word they kept your own also will they keep.
content_old: 20 Remember the word which I spake unto you: A servant is not greater than his lord. If me they persecuted you too will they persecute,— If my word they kept your own also will they keep.

content: 21 But all these things will they do unto you､ on account of my name, Because they know not him that sent me.
content_old: 21 But all these things will they do unto you､ on account of my name, Because they know not him that sent me.

content: 22 Had I not come and spoken unto them Sin had they none; But now have they no excuse for their sin.
content_old: 22 Had I not come and spoken unto them Sin had they none; But now have they no excuse for their sin.

content: 23 He that hateth me hateth my Father also.
content_old: 23 He that hateth me hateth my Father also.

content: 24 Had I not done among them the works which no other had done Sin had they none; But now have they､ both seen and hated both me and my Father.
content_old: 24 Had I not done among them the works which no other had done Sin had they none; But now have they､ both seen and hated both me and my Father.

content: 25 But … that the word which in their law is written､ might be fulfilled— They hated me without cause.
content_old: 25 But … that the word which in their law is written､ might be fulfilled— They hated me without cause.

content: 26 Whensoever the Advocate shall come, Whom I will send unto you from the Father,— The Spirit of truth､ which from the Father cometh forth He will bear witness concerning me:
content_old: 26 Whensoever the Advocate shall come, Whom I will send unto you from the Father,— The Spirit of truth､ which from the Father cometh forth He will bear witness concerning me:

content: 1 These things have I spoken unto you, That ye may not be caused to stumble:
content_old: 1 These things have I spoken unto you, That ye may not be caused to stumble:

content: 2 Excommunicants from the synagogue will they make you; Nay! there cometh an hour､ That everyone who killeth you shall think to be rendering divine service unto God!
content_old: 2 Excommunicants from the synagogue will they make you; Nay! there cometh an hour､ That everyone who killeth you shall think to be rendering divine service unto God!

content: 3 And these things will they do, Because they got to know､ neither the Father nor me.
content_old: 3 And these things will they do, Because they got to know､ neither the Father nor me.

content: 4 But these things have I told you,— That whensoever their hour shall come Ye may remember､ that thereof I told you. These things however､ I told you not､ from the beginning, Because I was with you;
content_old: 4 But these things have I told you,— That whensoever their hour shall come Ye may remember､ that thereof I told you. These things however､ I told you not､ from the beginning, Because I was with you;

content: 5 But now I go my way unto him that sent me､ And not one from among you questioneth me— Whither goest thou?
content_old: 5 But now I go my way unto him that sent me､ And not one from among you questioneth me— Whither goest thou?

content: 6 But because these things I have told you Sorrow hath filled your heart.
content_old: 6 But because these things I have told you Sorrow hath filled your heart.

content: 7 But I the truth am telling you— It is profitable for you that I depart; For if I should not depart The Advocate would in nowise come unto you,— But if I go I will send him unto you.
content_old: 7 But I the truth am telling you— It is profitable for you that I depart; For if I should not depart The Advocate would in nowise come unto you,— But if I go I will send him unto you.

content: 8 And having come He will reprove the world— Concerning sin､ And concerning righteousness, And concerning judgment:
content_old: 8 And having come He will reprove the world— Concerning sin､ And concerning righteousness, And concerning judgment:

content: 9 Concerning sin､ indeed Because they are not believing on me;
content_old: 9 Concerning sin､ indeed Because they are not believing on me;

content: 10 But concerning righteousness Because unto the Father I go my way､ and no longer do ye behold me;
content_old: 10 But concerning righteousness Because unto the Father I go my way､ and no longer do ye behold me;

content: 11 And concerning judgment Because the ruler of this world hath been judged.
content_old: 11 And concerning judgment Because the ruler of this world hath been judged.

content: 12 Yet many things have I unto you to be saying,— But ye cannot bear them just now;
content_old: 12 Yet many things have I unto you to be saying,— But ye cannot bear them just now;

content: 13 Howbeit as soon as he hath come— The Spirit of truth He will guide you into all truth; For he will not speak from himself, But whatsoever he heareth he will speak､ And the coming things will he announce unto you.
content_old: 13 Howbeit as soon as he hath come— The Spirit of truth He will guide you into all truth; For he will not speak from himself, But whatsoever he heareth he will speak､ And the coming things will he announce unto you.

content: 14 He shall glorify me; For of mine shall he receive､ and announce unto you.
content_old: 14 He shall glorify me; For of mine shall he receive､ and announce unto you.

content: 15 All things､ whatsoever the Father hath are my own; Therefore said I— Of mine shall he receive､ and announce unto you.
content_old: 15 All things､ whatsoever the Father hath are my own; Therefore said I— Of mine shall he receive､ and announce unto you.

content: 16 A little while and no longer ye behold me; And again a little while and ye shall see me.
content_old: 16 A little while and no longer ye behold me; And again a little while and ye shall see me.

content: 17 Some of his disciples､ therefore､ said one to another— What is this which he is saying to us:— A little while and ye behold me not, And again a little while and ye shall see me; And— Because I go my way unto the Father?
content_old: 17 Some of his disciples､ therefore､ said one to another— What is this which he is saying to us:— A little while and ye behold me not, And again a little while and ye shall see me; And— Because I go my way unto the Father?

content: 18 They were saying､ therefore— What is this which he saith:— A little while? We know not what he is saying.
content_old: 18 They were saying､ therefore— What is this which he saith:— A little while? We know not what he is saying.

content: 19 Jesus took note､ that they were wishing to question him, and said unto them— Concerning this are ye enquiring one with another,— Because I said:— A little while and ye behold me not, And again a little while and ye shall see me?
content_old: 19 Jesus took note､ that they were wishing to question him, and said unto them— Concerning this are ye enquiring one with another,— Because I said:— A little while and ye behold me not, And again a little while and ye shall see me?

content: 20 Verily､ verily I say unto you— Ye shall weep and lament, But the world shall rejoice: Ye shall be grieved, But your grief into joy shall be turned.
content_old: 20 Verily､ verily I say unto you— Ye shall weep and lament, But the world shall rejoice: Ye shall be grieved, But your grief into joy shall be turned.

content: 21 A woman as soon as she is about to bring forth Hath grief､ because her hour hath come; But as soon as she hath given birth to the child No longer remembereth she the anguish､ By reason of the joy, that a human being into the world hath been born.
content_old: 21 A woman as soon as she is about to bring forth Hath grief､ because her hour hath come; But as soon as she hath given birth to the child No longer remembereth she the anguish､ By reason of the joy, that a human being into the world hath been born.

content: 22 And ye therefore､ now indeed have grief; But again will I see you, And your heart shall rejoice,— And your joy no one shall force from you.
content_old: 22 And ye therefore､ now indeed have grief; But again will I see you, And your heart shall rejoice,— And your joy no one shall force from you.

content: 23 And in that day shall ye request me nothing:— Verily､ verily I say unto you— Whatsoever ye shall ask the Father He will give you in my name.
content_old: 23 And in that day shall ye request me nothing:— Verily､ verily I say unto you— Whatsoever ye shall ask the Father He will give you in my name.

content: 24 Until even now ye have asked nothing in my name: Be asking､ and ye shall receive,— That your joy may be made full.
content_old: 24 Until even now ye have asked nothing in my name: Be asking､ and ye shall receive,— That your joy may be made full.

content: 25 These things in similitudes have I spoken unto you: There cometh an hour､ When no longer in similitudes will I speak unto you, But openly､ concerning the Father will I tell you.
content_old: 25 These things in similitudes have I spoken unto you: There cometh an hour､ When no longer in similitudes will I speak unto you, But openly､ concerning the Father will I tell you.

content: 26 In that day In my name shall ye ask:— And I say not that I will request the Father for you;
content_old: 26 In that day In my name shall ye ask:— And I say not that I will request the Father for you;

content: 27 For the Father himself dearly loveth you, Because ye have dearly loved me､ And believed that I from the Father came forth:—
content_old: 27 For the Father himself dearly loveth you, Because ye have dearly loved me､ And believed that I from the Father came forth:—

content: 28 I came forth out of the Father､ And have come into the world,— Again I leave the world､ And go unto the Father.
content_old: 28 I came forth out of the Father､ And have come into the world,— Again I leave the world､ And go unto the Father.

content: 29 His disciples say— See! now openly art thou speaking, And not a single similitude art thou using:
content_old: 29 His disciples say— See! now openly art thou speaking, And not a single similitude art thou using:

content: 30 Now we know､ that thou knowest all things､ And hast no need that one be questioning thee. Hereby do we believe､ That from God thou camest forth.
content_old: 30 Now we know､ that thou knowest all things､ And hast no need that one be questioning thee. Hereby do we believe､ That from God thou camest forth.

content: 31 Jesus answered them— As yet ye believe:
content_old: 31 Jesus answered them— As yet ye believe:

content: 32 Lo! there cometh an hour､ and hath come, That ye should be scattered､ each unto his own home; and me､ alone should leave;— And yet I am not alone, But the Father is with me.
content_old: 32 Lo! there cometh an hour､ and hath come, That ye should be scattered､ each unto his own home; and me､ alone should leave;— And yet I am not alone, But the Father is with me.

content: 1 These things spake Jesus, and lifting up his eyes unto heaven said:— Father! The hour is come! Glorify thy Son, That the Son may glorify thee,—
content_old: 1 These things spake Jesus, and lifting up his eyes unto heaven said:— Father! The hour is come! Glorify thy Son, That the Son may glorify thee,—

content: 2 Even as thou gavest him authority over all flesh, That as touching whatsoever thou hast given him He might give unto them life age-abiding.
content_old: 2 Even as thou gavest him authority over all flesh, That as touching whatsoever thou hast given him He might give unto them life age-abiding.

content: 3 And this is the age-abiding life, That they get to know thee､ the only real God, And him whom thou didst send, Jesus Christ.
content_old: 3 And this is the age-abiding life, That they get to know thee､ the only real God, And him whom thou didst send, Jesus Christ.

content: 4 I glorified thee on the earth, The work finishing､ which thou hast given me that I should do.
content_old: 4 I glorified thee on the earth, The work finishing､ which thou hast given me that I should do.

content: 5 And now glorify me—thou､ Father, With thyself､ with the glory which I had､ before the world’s existence､ with thee.
content_old: 5 And now glorify me—thou､ Father, With thyself､ with the glory which I had､ before the world’s existence､ with thee.

content: 6 I manifested thy name､ unto the men whom thou gavest me out of the world: Thine they were､ And to me thou gavest them, And thy word have they kept:
content_old: 6 I manifested thy name､ unto the men whom thou gavest me out of the world: Thine they were､ And to me thou gavest them, And thy word have they kept:

content: 7 Now have they come to know､ That all things､ as many as thou gavest me are from thee;
content_old: 7 Now have they come to know､ That all things､ as many as thou gavest me are from thee;

content: 8 And the declarations which thou gavest me have I given them, And they received them､ and came to know in truth, That from thee came I forth,— And they believed That thou didst send me forth.
content_old: 8 And the declarations which thou gavest me have I given them, And they received them､ and came to know in truth, That from thee came I forth,— And they believed That thou didst send me forth.

content: 9 I concerning them make request: Not concerning the world do I make request, But concerning them whom thou hast given me､ Because thine they are,—
content_old: 9 I concerning them make request: Not concerning the world do I make request, But concerning them whom thou hast given me､ Because thine they are,—

content: 10 And all my possessions are thine And thy possessions mine, And I have been glorified in them.
content_old: 10 And all my possessions are thine And thy possessions mine, And I have been glorified in them.

content: 11 And no longer am I in the world, And they are in the world,— And I unto thee am coming. Holy Father! Keep them in thy name which thou hast given me, That they may be one､ as we.
content_old: 11 And no longer am I in the world, And they are in the world,— And I unto thee am coming. Holy Father! Keep them in thy name which thou hast given me, That they may be one､ as we.

content: 12 When I was with them I kept them in thy name which thou hast given me,— And I kept watch, And none from among them went to destruction,— Save the son of destruction, That the Scripture might be fulfilled.
content_old: 12 When I was with them I kept them in thy name which thou hast given me,— And I kept watch, And none from among them went to destruction,— Save the son of destruction, That the Scripture might be fulfilled.

content: 13 But now unto thee am I coming; And these things am I speaking in the world, That they may have my own joy fulfilled in themselves.
content_old: 13 But now unto thee am I coming; And these things am I speaking in the world, That they may have my own joy fulfilled in themselves.

content: 14 I have given them thy word, And the world hated them､ Because they are not of the world— Even as I am not of the world.
content_old: 14 I have given them thy word, And the world hated them､ Because they are not of the world— Even as I am not of the world.

content: 15 I request not､ that thou wouldst take them out of the world､ But that thou wouldst keep them out of the evil:
content_old: 15 I request not､ that thou wouldst take them out of the world､ But that thou wouldst keep them out of the evil:

content: 16 Of the world they are not, Even as I am not of the world.
content_old: 16 Of the world they are not, Even as I am not of the world.

content: 17 Hallow them in the truth: Thine own word is truth.
content_old: 17 Hallow them in the truth: Thine own word is truth.

content: 18 Even as thou didst send me forth into the world I also send them forth into the world;
content_old: 18 Even as thou didst send me forth into the world I also send them forth into the world;

content: 19 And on their behalf I hallow myself, That they also may have become hallowed in truth.
content_old: 19 And on their behalf I hallow myself, That they also may have become hallowed in truth.

content: 20 Not however concerning these alone do I make request, But concerning them also who believe through their word on me:
content_old: 20 Not however concerning these alone do I make request, But concerning them also who believe through their word on me:

content: 21 That they all may be one,— Even as thou Father､ in me, And I in thee,— That they also in us may be;— That the world may believe that thou didst send me forth.
content_old: 21 That they all may be one,— Even as thou Father､ in me, And I in thee,— That they also in us may be;— That the world may believe that thou didst send me forth.

content: 22 And I the glory which thou hast given to me have given to them, That they may be one､ Even as we are one,—
content_old: 22 And I the glory which thou hast given to me have given to them, That they may be one､ Even as we are one,—

content: 23 I in them and thou in me; That they may have been perfected into one,— That the world may get to know､ That thou didst send me forth, And didst love them even as thou didst love me.
content_old: 23 I in them and thou in me; That they may have been perfected into one,— That the world may get to know､ That thou didst send me forth, And didst love them even as thou didst love me.

content: 24 Father! As touching that which thou hast given me I desire— That where I am They also may be with me, That they may behold my own glory which thou hast given me,— Because thou lovedst me､ before the foundation of the world.
content_old: 24 Father! As touching that which thou hast given me I desire— That where I am They also may be with me, That they may behold my own glory which thou hast given me,— Because thou lovedst me､ before the foundation of the world.

content: 25 Righteous Father! And so the world came not to know thee; But I came to know thee, And these came to know that thou didst send me forth:
content_old: 25 Righteous Father! And so the world came not to know thee; But I came to know thee, And these came to know that thou didst send me forth:

content: 1 Having said these things Jesus went out､ with his disciples､ across the winter-torrent of the Kedron, where was a garden,— into which he entered, he and his disciples.
