content: 2 Now Judas also who was delivering him up, knew the place; because oft had Jesus been gathered there､ with his disciples.
content_old: 2 Now Judas also who was delivering him up, knew the place; because oft had Jesus been gathered there､ with his disciples.

content: 3 Judas therefore receiving the band､ and officers from among the High-priests and from among the Pharisees cometh thither､ with lights and torches and weapons.
content_old: 3 Judas therefore receiving the band､ and officers from among the High-priests and from among the Pharisees cometh thither､ with lights and torches and weapons.

content: 4 Jesus therefore､ knowing all the things coming upon him went forth, and saith unto them— Whom seek ye?
content_old: 4 Jesus therefore､ knowing all the things coming upon him went forth, and saith unto them— Whom seek ye?

content: 5 They answered him— Jesus､ the Nazarene. He saith unto them— I am he. Now Judas also､ who was delivering him up､ was standing with them.
content_old: 5 They answered him— Jesus､ the Nazarene. He saith unto them— I am he. Now Judas also､ who was delivering him up､ was standing with them.

content: 6 When､ therefore､ he said unto them I am he they went backwards､ and fell to the ground.
content_old: 6 When､ therefore､ he said unto them I am he they went backwards､ and fell to the ground.

content: 7 Again therefore､ he questioned them— Whom seek ye? And they said— Jesus､ the Nazarene.
content_old: 7 Again therefore､ he questioned them— Whom seek ye? And they said— Jesus､ the Nazarene.

content: 8 Jesus answered— I told you I am he If､ then､ ye seek me let these go their way:—
content_old: 8 Jesus answered— I told you I am he If､ then､ ye seek me let these go their way:—

content: 9 that the word might be fulfilled which he had said— As touching them whom thou hast given me I lost from among them､ not so much as one.
content_old: 9 that the word might be fulfilled which he had said— As touching them whom thou hast given me I lost from among them､ not so much as one.

content: 10 Simon Peter､ therefore､ having a sword drew it､ and smote the High-priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. Now the name of the servant was Malchus.
content_old: 10 Simon Peter､ therefore､ having a sword drew it､ and smote the High-priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. Now the name of the servant was Malchus.

content: 11 Jesus､ therefore､ said unto Peter— Thrust the sword into its sheath:— The cup which the Father hath given me shall I in anywise not drink it?
content_old: 11 Jesus､ therefore､ said unto Peter— Thrust the sword into its sheath:— The cup which the Father hath given me shall I in anywise not drink it?

content: 12 The band､ therefore､ and the captain, and the officers of the Jews apprehended Jesus､ and bound him,
content_old: 12 The band､ therefore､ and the captain, and the officers of the Jews apprehended Jesus､ and bound him,

content: 13 and led him unto Annas､ first; for he was father-in-law of Caiaphas, who was the High-priest of that year.
content_old: 13 and led him unto Annas､ first; for he was father-in-law of Caiaphas, who was the High-priest of that year.

content: 14 Now Caiaphas was he that gave counsel unto the Jews, that it was profitable for one man to die in behalf of the people.
content_old: 14 Now Caiaphas was he that gave counsel unto the Jews, that it was profitable for one man to die in behalf of the people.

content: 15 And Simon Peter was following with Jesus, also another disciple. But that disciple was known unto the High-priest, and entered in､ with Jesus､ into the court of the High-priest;
content_old: 15 And Simon Peter was following with Jesus, also another disciple. But that disciple was known unto the High-priest, and entered in､ with Jesus､ into the court of the High-priest;

content: 16 whereas Peter remained standing at the door outside. The other disciple､ therefore､ that was known of the High-priest went out and spake unto the portress､ and brought in Peter.
content_old: 16 whereas Peter remained standing at the door outside. The other disciple､ therefore､ that was known of the High-priest went out and spake unto the portress､ and brought in Peter.

content_old: 17 The female servant､ therefore､ the portress, saith unto Peter— Art thou also from among the disciples of this man? He saith— I am not!

content: 18 Now the servants and the officers were standing by, having made a coal fire because it was cold,—and were warming themselves; and Peter also was with them, standing and warming himself.
content_old: 18 Now the servants and the officers were standing by, having made a coal fire because it was cold,—and were warming themselves; and Peter also was with them, standing and warming himself.

content_old: 19 The High-priest､ therefore､ questioned Jesus concerning his disciples, and concerning his teaching.

content: 20 Jesus answered him— I openly have spoken unto the world,— I ever taught in synagogue､ and in the temple, where all the Jews gather together; and in secret spake nothing:
content_old: 20 Jesus answered him— I openly have spoken unto the world,— I ever taught in synagogue､ and in the temple, where all the Jews gather together; and in secret spake nothing:

content: 21 Why questionest thou me? question them who have heard､ what I spake unto them. See! these know what I said.
content_old: 21 Why questionest thou me? question them who have heard､ what I spake unto them. See! these know what I said.

content: 22 And when these things he had said one of the officers who was standing by gave a smart blow to Jesus, saying— Thus answerest thou the High-priest?
content_old: 22 And when these things he had said one of the officers who was standing by gave a smart blow to Jesus, saying— Thus answerest thou the High-priest?

content: 23 Jesus answered him— If with abuse I spake bear witness of the abuse; But if with respect why smitest thou me?
content_old: 23 Jesus answered him— If with abuse I spake bear witness of the abuse; But if with respect why smitest thou me?

content: 24 Annas therefore sent him forth､ bound, unto Caiaphas the High-priest.
content_old: 24 Annas therefore sent him forth､ bound, unto Caiaphas the High-priest.

content: 25 Now Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. They said､ therefore､ unto him— Art thou also from among his disciples? He denied, and said— I am not!
content_old: 25 Now Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. They said､ therefore､ unto him— Art thou also from among his disciples? He denied, and said— I am not!

content: 26 Saith one from among the servants of the High-priest, being kinsman of him whose ear Peter cut off,— Did not I see thee in the garden with him?
content_old: 26 Saith one from among the servants of the High-priest, being kinsman of him whose ear Peter cut off,— Did not I see thee in the garden with him?

content_old: 27 Again therefore､ Peter denied. And straightway a cock crew.

content: 28 So they lead Jesus from Caiaphas unto the judgment-hall. Now it was early; and they themselves entered not into the judgment-hall, that they might not be defiled､ but might eat the passover.
content_old: 28 So they lead Jesus from Caiaphas unto the judgment-hall. Now it was early; and they themselves entered not into the judgment-hall, that they might not be defiled､ but might eat the passover.

content_old: 29 Pilate､ therefore､ went forth outside unto them, and saith— What accusation bring ye against this man?

content: 30 They answered and said unto him— If this one had not been doing mischief unto thee had we not delivered him up.
content_old: 30 They answered and said unto him— If this one had not been doing mischief unto thee had we not delivered him up.

content: 31 Pilate､ therefore､ said unto them— Ye take him, and according to your law judge ye him. The Jews said unto him— Unto us it is not allowed､ to kill anyone!—
content_old: 31 Pilate､ therefore､ said unto them— Ye take him, and according to your law judge ye him. The Jews said unto him— Unto us it is not allowed､ to kill anyone!—

content: 32 that the word of Jesus might be fulfilled､ which he spake､ signifying by what manner of death he was about to die.
content_old: 32 that the word of Jesus might be fulfilled､ which he spake､ signifying by what manner of death he was about to die.

content: 33 Pilate､ therefore､ entered again into the judgment-hall; and addressed Jesus, and said unto him— Art thou the king of the Jews?
content_old: 33 Pilate､ therefore､ entered again into the judgment-hall; and addressed Jesus, and said unto him— Art thou the king of the Jews?

content: 34 Jesus answered— Of thyself art thou this thing saying; or did others tell thee concerning me?
content_old: 34 Jesus answered— Of thyself art thou this thing saying; or did others tell thee concerning me?

content: 35 Pilate answered— Am I a Jew? Thine own nation､ and the High-priests delivered thee up unto me! What hast thou done?
content_old: 35 Pilate answered— Am I a Jew? Thine own nation､ and the High-priests delivered thee up unto me! What hast thou done?

content: 36 Jesus answered— My kingdom is not of this world: If of this world had been my kingdom mine own officers would have been striving､ that I should not be delivered up unto the Jews: But now my kingdom is not from hence.
content_old: 36 Jesus answered— My kingdom is not of this world: If of this world had been my kingdom mine own officers would have been striving､ that I should not be delivered up unto the Jews: But now my kingdom is not from hence.

content: 37 Pilate､ therefore､ said unto him— And yet thou art not a king? Jesus answered— Thou sayest､ that a king I am:— I for this have been born, and for this have come into the world,—that I may bear witness unto the truth: Every one who is of the truth hearkeneth unto my voice.
content_old: 37 Pilate､ therefore､ said unto him— And yet thou art not a king? Jesus answered— Thou sayest､ that a king I am:— I for this have been born, and for this have come into the world,—that I may bear witness unto the truth: Every one who is of the truth hearkeneth unto my voice.

content: 38 Pilate saith unto him— What is truth? And this saying again went he out to the Jews, and saith unto them— I find in him not a single fault.
content_old: 38 Pilate saith unto him— What is truth? And this saying again went he out to the Jews, and saith unto them— I find in him not a single fault.

content: 39 Howbeit ye have a custom, that some one I should release unto you､ during the passover:— Are ye minded､ then､ that I release unto you the king of the Jews?
content_old: 39 Howbeit ye have a custom, that some one I should release unto you､ during the passover:— Are ye minded､ then､ that I release unto you the king of the Jews?

content_old: 3 and kept coming unto him, and saying— Joy to thee! O King of the Jews!— and were giving unto him smart blows.

content: 4 And Pilate went forth again outside, and saith unto them— See! I lead him unto you outside, that ye may take knowledge､ that no single fault do I find in him.
content_old: 4 And Pilate went forth again outside, and saith unto them— See! I lead him unto you outside, that ye may take knowledge､ that no single fault do I find in him.

content: 5 Jesus､ therefore､ came forth outside, wearing the thorn crown､ and the purple mantle. And he saith unto them— Lo! the Man!
content_old: 5 Jesus､ therefore､ came forth outside, wearing the thorn crown､ and the purple mantle. And he saith unto them— Lo! the Man!

content: 6 When､ therefore､ the High-priests and the officers saw him they cried aloud､ saying— Crucify! Crucify! Pilate saith unto them— Ye take him, and crucify; for I find not in him a fault.
content_old: 6 When､ therefore､ the High-priests and the officers saw him they cried aloud､ saying— Crucify! Crucify! Pilate saith unto them— Ye take him, and crucify; for I find not in him a fault.

content: 10 Pilate､ therefore､ saith unto him— Unto me dost thou not speak? Knowest thou not､ that authority have I to release thee, and authority have I to crucify thee?
content_old: 10 Pilate､ therefore､ saith unto him— Unto me dost thou not speak? Knowest thou not､ that authority have I to release thee, and authority have I to crucify thee?

content: 11 Jesus answered him— Thou couldst have had no authority against me at all, if it had not been given unto thee from above. Therefore he that delivered me unto thee hath greater sin.
content_old: 11 Jesus answered him— Thou couldst have had no authority against me at all, if it had not been given unto thee from above. Therefore he that delivered me unto thee hath greater sin.

content_old: 12 For this cause Pilate began seeking to release him; but the Jews cried aloud saying— If this man thou release thou art not a friend of Cæsar, for every one who maketh himself king speaketh against Cæsar.
